{{also|alter|älter|alter-}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|alter}}, from {{inh|de|goh|altar}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*aldrą}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds-de|Oller}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|most of Germany, some of Austria}} {{IPA|de|/ˈaltər/|[ˈʔältʰɐ]|[ˈʔaltʰɐ]|[ˈʔɑltɑ]|}} * {{a|Switzerland, some of Germany and Austria}} {{IPA|de|/ˈaltər/|[ˈʔɑltər]|}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Alter.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-Alter.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n||Alter}} # [[age]], [[old age]] #* '''1834''', ''Rahel. Ein Buch des Andenkens für ihre Freunde. Erster Theil'', Berlin, p. 275: #*: Sie sind Eines Alters [...] #*:: They are of the same age [...] # [[antiquity]] # [[epoch]], [[age]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|s}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Altersangabe}} * {{l|de|Altersaufbau}} * {{l|de|Altersdiskriminierung}} * {{l|de|Altersdurchschnitt}} * {{l|de|Alterserscheinung}} * {{l|de|Altersfrage}} * {{l|de|Altersgrenze}} * {{l|de|Altersgruppe}} * {{l|de|Mittelalter}} * {{l|de|Jugendalter}} * {{l|de|Zeitalter}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bor=1|lb|Alter}} ====See also==== * {{l|de|alters}} ({{l|de|Alters}}) ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Alten|Alte|f=Alte}} # {{nominalization of|de|alt|t=someone or something old or bygone}} # [[old]] [[man]]; old person (male or of unspecified sex) # {{lb|de|colloquial}} [[mate]], [[bloke]] {{a|UK}}; [[dude]], [[guy]] {{a|US}}; {{ngd|a somewhat intimate or mildly dismissive word for a man, especially but not exclusively used as a [[vocative]]}} #: {{ux|de|'''Alter!''' Komm zurück, wir müssen hier links.|'''Dude!''' Come back, we need to go left here.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Haste ma ’n Euro für was zu essen, '''Alter'''?|You got a euro for summat to eat, '''mate'''? (''by a homeless person'')|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Wenn irgendso’n '''Alter''' hier Ärger macht, schmeiß ihn gleich raus.|If some '''bloke''' acts up in here, kick him right out.|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Ihr '''Alter''' hat sie sitzen lassen.|Her '''guy''' jilted her.|inline=1}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj+noun-m|Alt||-|datpl=}} ===Interjection=== {{head|de|interjection}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|chiefly|slang}} [[man]]; [[dude]]; {{ngd|used for emphasis}} #: {{ux|de|'''Alter''', was denn hier los?|'''Man''', what’s going on in here?}} ====Usage notes==== * This use is derived from the word for a man above and is not always clearly distinguishable from it. It is more marked as slang, however, and is also quite common when addressing a female (the latter part in line with the more usual synonym {{m|de||Mann}}). ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Mann}} ===Noun=== {{head|de|noun form|g=f}} # {{inflection of|de|Alte||str|gen//dat|s|;|str|gen|p}} ===References=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|lb|de|Alter|g=n}}. The masculine gender, though existing dialectally in German, is probably triggered by {{der|lb|fr|âge}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈalteʀ/|[ˈɑltɐ]}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|Alteren}} # [[age]] # [[old age]]
